snippet: The New Jersey governor called the Supreme Court’s ruling “insulting,” but he faces a challenge in trying to please the voters in his state and those in his party.
abstract: New Jersey Democratic lawmakers seek to put Republican Gov Chris Christie on defensive for his opposition to same-sex marriage, accusing him of standing in way of history after Supreme Court rulings acknowledged equal rights of gays and lesbians; say they will push to override Christie’s veto of the same-sex marriage bill passed by State Legislature in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The New Jersey governor called the Supreme Court’s ruling “insulting,” but he faces a challenge in trying to please the voters in his state and those in his party.

headline.main: Democrats Push Christie to Support Gay Marriage
headline.print_headline: Democrats Push Christie To Support Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
